instruction: How were the machine learning techniques used to model and map the mercury concentrations in the soil dataset?
Output: The machine learning techniques, including Random Forest (RF), Extreme Gradient Boosting (XGboost), Cubist, and k-Nearest Neighbor (kNN), were employed to model and map the mercury (Hg) concentrations in the soil dataset. These techniques were used to analyze the soil dataset of 250 points sampled from a 0-20 cm depth on different land uses in the city of Ufa (Russia) and adjacent areas. The ML models were calibrated and validated using the leave-one-out cross-validation approach. Remote sensing data (RSD) and topographic attributes were used as explanatory variables in the modeling process. The ML models were trained to predict the Hg concentrations based on these variables and then used to create spatial maps of Hg distribution in the study area.
